title: Very good system
text:
Bought both the iGrill2 and 2 minis for my home kitchen, since I grill and smoke almost daily. Bought extra probes too. 
Setup: Incredibly simple. After unpacking and sorting out probe colors, first big cook required all 6 probes - very easy to connect and activate. The app, however, is not there yet. Setting up cook parameters is fiddly and complex. Others have remarked on the poor alarms and disappointing features, notably TROAB - 9 Aug. The app needs MUCH more work. 
Reliability: strong, but the Bluetooth connection can be squirrelly at times. Most of the time, it was solid for me.
Style: excellent. The transmitters are discrete and on the Traeger, the Holland and the Weber, the magnetic mounts are great. On the BGE and the Kamado, not so muc. I used the metal buttons included but they don't stick to the wood bench very well, so I have the transmitters sitting on my bench instead, much less tidy.
Conclusion: An excellent product. Fix the app, eliminate the fluff cookbook feature and clean off the advertising, concentrate on adding features like remembering cooking cycles and adding extra alarm features is very important. For a new product, though, nice try.

Due to constant, faulty application updates, you will spend all of your time troubleshooting problems with their products. I regret purchasing the numerous iDevices products that I have. It was a very costly mistake for me.

title: Clean interface and my go-to for most changes
text: Originally I was put off by a lack of a feature but then they updated the app with the critical hold option for the thermostat and this has quickly become my favorite App for most HomeKit changes.  The interface is easy and clear.  Much better than another App touted and reviewed as the best out there.  The only reason for using that App is a couple features not found on other Apps.  This App would be an easy 5 star with just a few more features.  One of them is the GeoFence.  On the other App you can chose a GPS fence around your home and tell it that if you enter the zone before sunrise and after dark turn the porch and walk lights on, etc.  Also, the other App allows for some more detailed trigger-based programming of scenes.  Add GPS and some "Macro" or basic logic programming based on time, events, statuses, and this App would be amazing I think.

title: Life changing
text: These devices and this app changed my life.  My kids are always leaving tv and video games on. Being able to control what devices are turned on and turn them off remotely is the best. Even better is being able to see energy usage. My energy savings on my power bill are sure to pay off these switches in no time.  No central hub is needed like with the other guys. With this app, iDevices remote servers give you access to your smart devices that are connected to your home's wifi, while you control them from other locations with your phone. It's fantastic!  One thing I wish is to see all iDevices  power usage in one report. Or if they did have a central hub...maybe something that attaches to your home meter to compare with your devices recordings and your homes usage...even compare with your power bill. That would make it even better.

title: Great devices (switches); great app
text:
Although a little patience was required to set them up (I have 6), I finally figured out to reset them by holding the side button in until reset occurred and was able to put all in my network. They have been incredibly reliable and Siri control easily obtained as the switches are Apple HomeKit compatible. The app recognizes my Lutron, Hues, and ConnectSense devices but of course not my Z-wave based Piper NV camera. A word of caution: use a consistent naming format by naming each device the same name if using devices from multi- manufactures. Scenes are easy to set up and implement.  
The app allows a custom photo for each device which is extremely nice. 
Suggestions are to implement geofencing and allowing 2 separate device names for the double switch devices from ConnectSense. 
Overall, great devices and app from iDevics!

title: Great app. Highly recommend the product
text: This app works exactly as it's supposed to. I've used it twice now, once with my iPhone and once on my iPad, and both times my iGrill mini paired quickly without any issue. I smoked a turkey breast for 8 hours one day and every time I came back into Bluetooth range of the iGrill mini the app reconnected easily and gave me a report for the entire time I was out of range. The social sharing element is easy and and it's really fun to see who else is using the app nearby. The iGrill Facebook page even liked and commented on the photo I shared from the app, which made my experience feel really personal. I'm sure the team at iDevices has already hammered out any of the bugs reported by other reviewers already, so I wouldn't let their reviews concern me. I'd recommend it to anyone. A+, seriously.

title: Unresponsive and a bit buggy
text:
Tapping in the app is hit or miss.  Sometimes need to repeatedly tap for it to register. Design is straightforward enough, but navigating is clunky.  Occasionally app flashes several screens rapidly, and can end up on a page that is obviously an error.  Bluetooth connection is quick and easy and appears to display correct temperature.  Used only with iGrill2, so can't comment on using with other devices.  Sub-par product at a premium price.

One last annoyance: can not access anything in the app unless the device is turned on and the Bluetooth is connected. If you are trying to create some preset cooking alerts, you must first turn on the iGrill2 and connect it.  Since the navigation and layout of the app are a bit difficult, it would be nice to be able to set things up ahead of time.  I wanted to look up some recipes on my computer and program them into the app on my phone.  Had to wait until everything was together and running.  I suspect the creators of this app don't BBQ themselves.

title: Disappointed!!
text:
Purchased 2 Switches and 1 Eve Door and Window device from Apple Store as adjuncts to my Security System. Seemed easier than Alexa et al for lights. Only 1 Switch works. So much potential!  1 Switch had been opened and apparently returned to Apple Store. Didn‚Äôt notice until I got home. It could not be reset. Never should have been on shelf. 1 Switch synced quickly and easily. Love it. Too soon to know if it will have same problems as other reviewers. Door and Window device cannot be used with any type of curved or fancy moldings around a door - flat surfaces only. I tried everything I could think of doing, save cutting into woodwork. No go. Called company and voice system put me on HOLD forever. I finally gave up. Returning Eve and faulty Switch. So much potential!
UPDATE:  remaining 2 light switches work 5% of the time w iPhones Siri. Very frustrating. Not worth the time and money.

title: Best homecare controller available
text:
I'll certainly start off by saying this app is not perfect. In fact the design, leaves quite a bit to be desired. It would certainly be nice if there is a quick way to get to a single page in control all your devices, but there's not.

But that said, I have to give credit to an app that truly works as HomeKit should. I have tried nearly all the apps on the App Store for HomeKit control and find this one to be the only one that works interactively with other vendors devices. My Lutron lights, and I home plugs all show up and function with this app. The scenes I've created in other apps all are available in this app. That's what the beauty of HomeKit is supposed to provide. So while today, I don't own an idevices device, I still think their app is the best HomeKit controller in the app store.

title: I really wish it worked...
text: this device is not ready! i purchased this device in anticipation of Apple's HomeKit software integration in Sept. the box promises A lot, and delivers none. Control with Siri, does NOT work. ( i gave it a pass on this because maybe it will work in sept ), Control remotely, i've only been able to control it while connected to my home wifi network. Set schedules, the schedule i set to run all week only ran 2 days then stayed on the rest of the time ( basically leaving my lights on for 4 days while i was out of town )... bottom line if THEIR OWN software app doesn't work ( and feels clumsy ) then i don't know how they expect it to operate smoothly with apple's homekit. on the positive side it does have a pretty led light strip, and is quick to set up ( & quick to fail )... i am returning this... i won't be stuck with it if it doesn't work with homekit... also by comparision nest is 98% flawless, i wish they had a wifi outlet.

title: Nice alerts tics
text: I have been using Insteon remote for my lights for the last few years, when it works it is great, but every few months it goes haywire and I need to pull out all the switches reset the modem and delete the program... Last week I decided to chuck it and find a wireless mobile no modem answer that works as stable as nest...so far  Idevice seems great after a week of using it on my outdoor lights... I needed to up my wireless with another airport express and my cell to a 9.0 operating system but a very easy setup. .. Keep in mind that if u want to use it away from home u must have an updated apple product or a Apple TV 3 or better .. Looking into a few more of their products if it stays stable...

title: Good but some bugs
text: Generally pretty good but still some bugs and also missing some features I'd really like to see.  Bugs include scheduled times are not syncing or reflected on all devices - for example my outdoor lights "on" scene setpoint time (set on iPad) does not show when I look at the same scene on my iPhone (in fact iPhone shows very old and incorrect "on" time). Missing features include not being able to reference on and off times to local sunset and sunrise times. - these change minutes per day and requires that I frequently manually update many scenes.  Still many comms issues with app not reflecting actual state of switches (app shows off yet switch is actually on and vice versa).  Overall I like the products but app is not as good as the actual switches.

title: Don't spend money on iDevices
text:
Very expensive switch module died (no LED light showing/no device found on app) after a few months. I don't think I'll waste any more money on iDevices when there's so many other choices. I'd hoped to build on this system. Glad I didn't buy anything else expensive from them.
Seeing the recent reviews, it's not a difficult decision to switch to a competitor. Prior to my switch dying, I'd experienced problems with every update. Even though iDevices always says "nothing in the update should have caused connection problems". It seems unbelievable that it's always a "coincidence" that it stops working after an update. That's probably what blew out my switch.
Note how many times in reviews that they reply that the update shouldn't have caused connectivity problems. Do you believe them, or the customers it keeps happening to, "coincidently", over and over again.

title: iGrill-mini an iGreat improvement
text: Having been an iGrill user for a number of years, this iGrill-mini really improves the Connectivity to Bluetooth for iPads and iPhones. The New Connection App (don't use the iGrill App) totally connects to One or More iGrill-minis completely and Automatically Pairs the devices. We often cook using the NuWave counter-top infrared cooker. Therefore I have two minis and two probes, the Meat probe is used for the Meat, and the 2nd probe is an Ambient Probe, so that I know the cooking temperature inside the NuWave. Love it. Power is by a Standard Button Battery CR2032 which lasts for 150 hours. The battery shelf life is many years so buy several and keep them in the Box, in the event Power is an issue, you have them on hand.

title: Well rounded app
text:
...Although I‚Äôve noticed one weird quirk recently, which could just as easily be a design flaw in HoneKit. While going on vacation across two time zones I noticed that the settings adjusted to times at my location! As far as I knew the house did not travel with us and headache of noticing and adjusting timing to this reality in my head was an unnecessary one! If HomeKit is not smart enough to accommodate the reality that buildings are static in nature and that we tend to quantify timing based on it‚Äôs local time, maybe your app can offer a time zone lock feature.
As the end of August has come and gone this flaw necessarily impacts everyone twice a year, not just travelers. You have to manually readjust for daylight savings too!

title: Amazing customer support and great product
text:
I use the app solely for the iGrill2.

The ability to raise a support ticket through the app itself is a great feature. The amazing  customer service is a just a bonus. 
Would like to see the ability to monitor temps remotely as the Bluetooth range can diminish greatly through exterior walls. The ability to have more than 1 device monitoring the temps would be good too. Perhaps the Bluetooth connected device could then broadcast the info over a wifi connection?? 
I would also like to see the ability to save graphs to the app and add notes for quick and easy reference later. Overall great product and I have recommended it to others.

title: Finally a good Thermometer
text:
The best cooking thermometer I've ever used (I've bought a lot of them) also happens to connect to my iPhone. The connection to my phone wasn't really a selling point for me at the time of purchase, but now I won't buy another probe without that feature.  The ability to graph the temp over time really tells the tale of temperature trending the food and grill/smoker/fryer ect.  The Bluetooth range is outstanding as long as you can get some elevation on the transmitter, which is the key for any wifi/Bluetooth device.

This kind of temperature monitoring was previously only available for industrial applications. Kudos iDevices.

title: Great App for Smoking!
text:
Reading most of the reviews on this app you can tell people don't always understand the device they are working with. The app has nothing to do with the Bluetooth range, which is great for a Bluetooth device if you are using the iGrill2 (the range on the mini isn't as good). 

Alarms are easy to set and work great if you are in range.  The alarm goes off on the phone and the device itself which is nice. 

Everything is easy to read, you can customize the views as needed, and it works great on my 6+ with no scaling issues. I don't have an apple watch so I am not sure how that part of the app does.

title: Love it, but needs improvement
text:
I'll start off by saying I love my iGrill2.  It does all the things they say it will do.  Here are the nit picky thing that would make it so much better:
-Custom alert tones: why not just let me use apples built in Notification Center settings?
-No landscape mode??? This is especially awkward on my iPad which is more comfortable in landscape orientation.. Both in use and propped on the counter
-Over alerting when approaching a threshold: when my smoker or good reached its temperature I have to constantly dismiss the reoccurring alerts or else fumble through the interface to clear the whole setting. I expect that on my old maverick but on a device with this interface I expect more: a snooze option or even an additional threshold ( if you have ever had trouble getting your smoker to the right temperature and had it fluctuate it hover at one end of the range, you'll know what I mean)

All in all I love this setup and wouldn't give it up, but I hope idevices continues to improve the app and doesn't rest on the fact that it's already "good enough"

title: Will not stay connected via IPad Pro hub.
text: So I'll start with saying that these work fairly well when your at home on your own wifi network. Once you venture out of your house and no longer connect to your router that's when you start having issues. My IDevices app will not stay connected to my devices. Almost every time I want to turn a device on when I'm away from home the dang things will not connect until I cycle them through an on/off cycle. This doesn't not work the way they should. They should have a constant connection with the app so that I can have Siri turn on the device without having to go to the app and manually cycle the power toggle until it connects. I hope that this will get fixed but in the mean time I will be looking at other brands. Good hardware horrible software.

title: Mixed bag
text: I love the convenience of being able to manage the thermostat from my phone and with Siri, that‚Äôs the whole point of this kind of product, and that works but there are a couple things with this app that just don‚Äôt. Setting up a schedule was easy enough (though it could be better) - however the thermostat ignores it, it doesn‚Äôt change when it‚Äôs supposed to, even without override ever being used. Overriding on a timer doesn‚Äôt work - doesn‚Äôt matter how long or short I set it it just stays on indefinitely. Other minor things too but those are the biggest problems...

title: Worst Interface EVER
text: Of all the apps I have used this has to be the least intuitive ever.  Learning curve is way too long and the implementation is cumbersome.  Add to this that the app will not allow me to add a scene name when setting up a new action and it is just frustrating.  I have just one iDevices switch that I purchased as a trial because I liked the concept.  The switch wouldn't link to my older "n" router, customer service didn't have a solution and said the switch was probably defective.  I upgraded my router to a new "ac" version from Asus and it linked flawlessly although the switch does not require "ac". Other reviews for the switch also show problems connecting.  Bottom line is that the combination of the switch and this app is VERY poorly implemented. I am returning the switch.  I do not recommend.

title: App is for advertising
text: This app is not centered to enhance the thermometers functionality, it was made to sell and advertise. The functions for the high priced thermometer I purchased are scattered amongst the advertising features. I didnt buy a cookbook, and I dont need to buy more of your products to use mine. Just give me an app that has a quickly accessible timer and shows the temperature without fuss. I generally use another timer because the one included is obscured and less important then the cooking advertising included, based on its placement in the app. This is like buying a movie and forcing you to fast forwarding through the previews just to watch the movie. I PAID YOU, why are you still bothering me... Not recommended to others until my purchase is validated by placing concern for my experience first. Update!

title: One other thing
text:
I also would like to have a remote connection and the ability to connect to more than 1 device.  Sounds like it would be simple, I would even be up for paying a small fee if needed for the data servers, but having a bluetooth only connection is tuff.  I feel strapped to the smoker.  

I should be able to place the iPad or device close to the smoker have the data update on your servers and I be able to see the resulst on another device.  Im always running to the store during my 12 hour smoke, but I would like to see how I am doing remotely.

title: Shining example
text: I've been using this app to control my indoor and outdoor iDevices switches for 5 or 6 months.  This app opens faster than any of the many apps I have on my iPhone.  The app also recognized and installed all of my Lutron, Caseta products.  I use the iDevices app to control about 42 smarthome products flawlessly.  I had a couple of questions, and called iDevices customer service.  This is where iDevices really shines, you talk to real, intelligent person that answers questions with a smile.  This app is truly a shining example of how apps should work.

title: Look elsewhere don‚Äôt waste your life
text: I‚Äôm no stranger to automated systems.  I computer program all the time and have used or tested systems of many types from low end to high end.   That said, I keep trying iDevices because on paper it looks so good.  Unfortunately, the system is so poor from a real world usability and reliability stand point, The biggest mystery is how they are still in business.   Software issues, can‚Äôt use more than one phone or iPad with it.  You get the circle of death half the time - so long to respond sometimes that I could mine my own copper, run the wire to a generator and throw the switch myself by the time it works.  Just downloading firmware can get you an infinite hold with no feedback other than the circle of death just spinning.  Truly a mystery.

title: Bluetooth fine. Base unit, not so much
text:
Have used the Kitchen unit for both oven and outdoor grill. Temperature-wise, the iKitchen has been spot on, yielding perfect chicken, steak, and burgers every time. Bluetooth has yet to fail, even with probe outdoors, about 50 feet away. Despite occasionally alarming that it is too far away from the iPhone or iPad, it has never permanently dropped the connection.
The frustration comes from the base unit appearing to turn off. Turns out that only the display, including BT light and probe indicators, goes dark, sometimes for the duration of use. Strangely, the device stays connected to the phone or pad, so no harm to the cooking.

title: Great UI
text:
I‚Äôm an Insteon user who also has an iGrill Mini, so when this update came out I was intrigued.

The Insteon Hub Pro app is a terribly complicated mess of UI that takes many taps to accomplish anything.  iDevices Connected allows me to control all of my Insteon products through their much more streamlined UI, while not having to upgrade my home setup to all new devices.

I highly recommend trying this app if you have a mix of HomeKit devices and want a nice UI to interact with them.  Can‚Äôt wait to check out some iDevices when they hit store shelves!

title: Tries to do be too much
text:
I am afraid I have to join the chorus of other accomplished cooks who want this app to have the BASIC functionality of the original iGrill i.e. the ability to display temp and graph for two or more probes, on an iPad, in landscape mode, without having to frequently wash hands to awaken or unlock the device. That's all many, many long-time users really want! 

I can't knock this software just because it doesn't do what I like. The original versions of iDevices Connected were buggy but I haven't had any problems for the last few. It has much more versatility than the original software/device pair. I only have the iGrill2 to use with it.

I like the new iGrill2 but the Bluetooth drops more (through metal siding) with the new software and iGrill2 than the original. I also wish that the probe leads came out the top to stay out of my way or how about this - a flippable display?

I see IGrill is growing and looking for people. I hope they hire someone to read these reviews and implement the basic improvements requested by long time users - i.e. customers.

title: Works nicely Smoking or grilling with the iGrill2
text:
I have been using this app for over a year and it works nicely for large pieces of meat. The graph is handy to estimate when it will be done, takes some of the the guessing out of a long cook. The app could use some improvements like the ability to save past plots along with cooking notes.
The bluetooth range doesn't go far in the house while monitoring a slow cook outside without loosing connection. It would be handy to access the connected iOS device over wifi so you can monitor plots and alarms over a wider range than Bluetooth.

title: Finally they did a update that now makes it great
text:
When I first purchased these devices I had a hard time configuring them and had to call support.  Support was great.

Unfortunately the devices keep disconnecting and became worthless after about 24 hrs.  I called support again and they said there was another update and the problem was my Apple router.  Did the update but no change, disconnected and didn't work after about one day.

I disconnected the devices and put them in the junk drawer.

About two months later I got a email from them saying they had another update and said it WILL fix the problem.  I blew it off and did nothing.

A few weeks later I was curious so I pulled out the devices and performed the update on the devices (not the app).

Wow!  They now work great.  Very useful.  

I would give a 5 star if it didn't take three months to finally get them updated so they work.  Love them now.

title: Has potential but still buggy
text:
The outdoor switch has potential but setup was very buggy and was not an easy process. Siri still does not work and I was told by Tech Support that this is a known issue. 

In terms of the app, it could be simpler. To schedule the switch to turn on/off each day it is one schedule for on and a second schedule for off. It would be simpler to have one schedule with both on/off times. Look at the iHome Smart Plug app - theirs is structured that way and much simpler. 

Finally, to turn off the schedule, it is three screens (4 "clicks" in total) in to enable or disable (and then you have to back out). So to disable the on/off schedule that is 8 "clicks" in and 6 "clicks" out -14 in total !! So make it simpler - you have the power on/off button on the home screen, so add a schedule on/off button (s) on the same home screen. 

Finally, I need to add that Customer Support has been great. They answer the phone quickly and respond to emails same day!! A shoutout to Lourdes who has been great to work with!! 

Thanks!

title: Best in class. Potential for growth.
text: Use this for long term smoking of brisket as well as in the kitchen. It's the best of its kind. Would like to see better controls for the temperature patterns for smoking (I.e. "stalls") and maybe a template for stuff like that with alarms for actions (ambient temperature is decreasing/increasing, plateau has been broken). Also, would like better integration into social media- I want to share the temperature graph when I do that. Also, also, would love to be able to have the unit connect to the web, so I don't lose the temperature history when I walk too far away.

title: Game Changer
text:
I was looking at this one in lieu of a different kind my friend has.  I made the right choice. I primarily use it on my smoker. I love that I can use 4 different probes to check different meats.  So far, Bluetooth seems to stay connected even when I am inside the house.  
The only thing that I would change is the base unit display goes dark while cooking and you need to use just your phone to see the temperature.  Maybe this is done to preserve battery life? It would be nice to have the option in settings.

title: Outdoor Switch
text:
I am so disappointed. I don‚Äôt understand why or how the outdoor switches are still being sold. There‚Äôs obviously an issue. Not even the app locates the switch regularly, but it sure identifies the non-iDevices smart gadgets in my home... They show up on the list, every time. As well, changed the names of a couple of non-iDevices gadgets in my a Home app, for items I personally named. 

To the company... Either post complete instructions, update the switch software, or whatever it is you need to do, so to provide the functions, as advertised.

‚ÄòHearing‚Äô the customer is great, however providing functioning products that you have described is excellence. At this time, your product and your customer service has failed.

title: Excellent HomeKit App
text:
The app setup is straightforward and easy.  All of system devices (7) were setup within 15 minutes.  The app has worked flawlessly to date even with other manufacturer's hardware.  It is a benefit to have pictures that can be added to the display system.  If you allow a guest user access to the system, the pictures are helpful.  

In summary, the system is easy to setup and works flawlessly. I recommend it as one of the two best HomeKit apps that I have tried.

title: Good, but not great
text:
For the $100 I paid for the iGrill2, I expected a lot more.

The Negatives:

You can't change your alert tones, and they are all very subtle and not ALERTING at all. Fortunately for me, my iPhone is jailbroken, so all I needed to do was swap out a .wav file with one of my choosing. I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO RESORT TO THIS.

The Bluetooth is also spotty. I'm not sure if it's the brick walls or what, but after about 15-20 feet it will just disconnect.

You can't reorder the probes in the app. Probe 1 will always be first, Probe 4 will always be last. Keep this in mind when you're placing probes.

The Positives:

Built in recipes
Built in timers
Built in temperatures
Custom peak temperature
Custom temperature range
Sharing temp logs is fast and easy

Overall:

I gave it a 3/5 because IMO the negatives outweigh the positives. The alarm tone is the single most important feature of the device, and they have yet to correct this. -1 star

-1 star for spotty Bluetooth. No way this has a range of 200 feet. Maybe in an empty field. But not in a house

title: Could be great but constantly loses connectivity
text: I love the promise of what this app can do. The charts and settings are great and informational and helpful. Can't comment on the alarm functionality because every couple hours of using the app fine, it would lose connectivity to the base and not come back unless I turned the base off and on again. Has happened 4 times already in an 8 hour period (cooking brisket).  Missed my ideal crutch point because of it.  Luckily I woke up otherwise a whole packet brisket could have been ruined...  Not sure why it is happening - it's brand new.  Still searching for a reliable wireless temp probe setup...

title: Useful
text:
Very good product. Could use some improvements though. 
1. Dumps info if you cook longer than maybe four hours (I use it for my offset smoker)
2. Is not able to save cook info other than a data file. Would like to save graph from start to finish. I'm forced to save screen shot. 
Other than those two points I can't think of anything else that would take away from its good points. It is very accurate and the bells and whistles keep you safe from major cockups!
This combined with beer is the best thing that has happened for smoking/BBQ!

title: Switch
text:
Bought one and had a little difficulty setting it up, instructions are not the clearest. Once I got it functioning it worked so well I bought two more from Lowes.

They need a good strong wifi signal to remain connected. One kept dropping off of the network. I moved it 12 feet closer and it has been rock solid. 

While on a trip to Europe we were able to turn lights on and off at home. You can also use the app to control the times you want the plugged in light or device to be turned on and off.

title: Really nice app except for Apple Watch
text: This is a really nice product that has added a lot to the quality of my cooking. I've recommended the iGrill Mini to many of my friends and relatives. Initially, the app worked well with my Apple Watch. At some point recently that has changed. I have reinstalled the app but that does not work. So, for now I'll rely on the phone which works just fine. Using the watch is really a waste of time at this point. So I'd give the overall product 5 stars without the Apple Watch app and 1 star for the watch app.

title: This is really a phone only app...I delayed releasing this comment.
text:
First unpublished review...We cook with iPads and the fact that the screen will not rotate and remains locked on portrait mode is NOT an improvement from original igrill app.  We will continue to use the old one until this is fixed.  

Now even worse....we purchased igrill mini and it will not lock to iPad mini as it used to do...yes I switched to the new app.   When it works it's wonderful when it doesn't which for is is most of the time I should have bought more steak or a better wine.  

I just ordered more because I thought it was fixed Don't waste your money until it's fixed.  When it is this stubborn guy will let you know!

title: Easy to Use
text: I have used this once and loved it. I will report back again after more frequent use. The ease of setting it up and monitoring the temperature was excellent. The visual graph for the meat's temperature is a nice touch. The alert via my iPhone was great as well. Much nicer than the old school monitor that I was using. I have yet to encounter any issues, product, customer service, or otherwise, and hope they can be avoided. My first use was cooking an apple wood smoked pork tenderloin on a Weber Performer. My next review will be influenced by my Weber gas and Primo ceramic grills.

title: Not what it once was
text:
As a user of the original iGrill (2 Probe) and now an iGrill 2 (4 Probe) I am reviewing this app not the device the old app allowed you rotate the screen for a more useful view! The app allowed for large bold numbers. The new app does not do that. The old app would stay on when used the new app does not. It shuts off. It was great when I could set it on the counter and glance over to it. Now I have to wash my hands to touch the screen unlock it and see where I am at (o wait it broke the pairing with BT) great!! 

Seems they have put large amounts of time into the app for office use not a real work person!! Maybe input from a user might be a suggestion. 

As for the product amazing - but lacking a better app!!

title: 5 STAR APP!!!!!!!!!!!!
text:

title: Great App
text:
The app is nice minus one thing. With the update to a black screen as opposed to the white background, it's harder to see the screen, especially if I'm sitting on the patio having a few drinks. You might give an option of white vs black in the next update. Otherwise I'd give you 5 stars. 

What I like about the app is the Bluetooth capability with my phone. That Rocks! I also like the charts and settings/alerts that tells me when my food is about done.

title: Purchased 8 Switches won't stay online.
text:
I have Lightify, 2 Radio Thermostat, two Chamberlain Garage door openers, 4 Foscam cameras and their wifi connections are almost always up. Top of the line CISCO. Router on a UPS and very seldom down on a 150mb connection. Yes at my home. 

These iDevice switches are down a lot and require removal and restart. I removed all from the network except one and still goes down requiring cold starts. They go down on either UPS and line power. Firmware updates seem a smoke screen to me. I'd love to see the firmware and hardware design. 

Called support and was treated poorly. Yes they treated a wireless standards engineer and process control system architect who owns an industrial wireless development company poorly. Of course they didn't know. 

I suggest highly avoiding this product until they guarantee uptime of near 5 9s.  I've given this company plenty of time to fix their issues. I was hoping for the best and wanted the product successful.

Apple should look more carefully at this product design. I'm sure they will find issues.

title: Works pretty well

With one exception I'm able to name devices, rooms, scenes, use voice commands to turn the switch off and on, and sync all of this info between my iPhone and iPad.  One thing I've not yet been able to do is sync scene schedules between my two devices. title: Not bad anymore (updated)

title: Do not buy the thermostat
text:
Takes multiple tries to pair. Requires an external device to setup. App cannot find the thermostat most of the time, forcing me to force shutdown app. Firmware updates cause thermostat to unpair and required a reset to default settings to pair again, which was more times app failed to find device.

I just want to program set time and temperatures without having an extra set of conditions  with these "scenes". The thermostat is a glorified analog thermostat.

title: Awesome
text:
Solid app and product.  Please ignore previous reviews that referred to old version.  I have installed 18 of these and have not had a single problem, as long as you do the following:

1. Plug in the new switch.
2. Press and hold the button on the side of the switch for 10 seconds to do a factory reset
3. Open this app, it will detect the new switch and will add it without trouble.
4. This app will advise you to update the firmware on the switch, which you should definitely do.
5. You're done!

I admit that in an ideal world you shouldn't have to do step #2 above.  I've learned that if you skip that step then you will get random errors when trying to add the switch.  Do step #2 and it will work flawlessly.
